results.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 806) to facilitate efficient State implementation of ground-level ozone standards, and for other purposes.
results.short_title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 806) to facilitate efficient State implementation of ground-level ozone standards, and for other purposes.
results.latest_major_action: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
results.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 806) to facilitate efficient State implementation of ground-level ozone standards.
results.summary_short: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 806) to facilitate efficient State implementation of ground-level ozone standards.

actions.description: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 235 - 188 (Roll no. 383).
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 188 (Roll no. 382).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 451, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question, and by voice vote announced that the ayes prevailed. Mr. Polis demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 451.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 235 - 188 (Roll no. 383). (text: CR H5927)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 188 (Roll no. 382). (consideration: CR H5940)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H5940-5941)
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5927-5935)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 65.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 806 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-229, by Mr. Burgess.
